abstract: Gambling website Pinnacle Sports suspends betting for mixed doubles match at Australian Open between Lara Arruabarrena and David Marrero and Andrea Hlavackova and Lukasz Kubot, raising concerns that match might be fixed; large amounts of money were bet on what would normally be obscure match, with nearly all of it on Hlavackova and Kubot, who won handily; concerns follow on heels of report in BBC and BuzzFeed about possible match fixing in tennis.

byline.original: By BEN ROTHENBERG and JAMES GLANZ
byline.contributor: Ben Rothenberg reported from Melbourne, and James Glanz from New York. Christopher Clarey contributed reporting from Melbourne, and Joe Drape from New York.

lead_paragraph: With tennis already under scrutiny over possible match fixing, money poured in on what would normally be an obscure mixed doubles match, leading Pinnacle Sports to suspend betting on it.

headline.print_headline: Obscure Tennis Match Draws Big Bets, and Then Suspicion
headline.main: Match-Fixing Suspicions Raised at Australian Open After Site Stops Bets on Match

snippet: With tennis already under scrutiny over possible match fixing, money poured in on what would normally be an obscure mixed doubles match, leading Pinnacle Sports to suspend betting on it....
